page.title: 18THE CEMETARY
page.content: I interviewed the man who looks after the graveyard. We asked him what was in the little shed and he told us he kept his lawnmowers in it. He is employed by the Parish Council and has done this work for three years. Not many people are buried there, about five a year. Some are family graves. In November 1984 there was so much rain the graves sank so more soil had to put on top.There are thirty eight trees down the middle of the graveyard. It takes two days to prune the trees. There is some ground at the back of the graveyard that is not being used.
